title: Effects of electrolyte type and concentration on the anodic oxidation of 4H-SiC (0001) in slurryless electrochemical mechanical polishing

samples.experiment_context: Anodic oxidation (AO) of N-type 4H-SiC (0001) wafer (TankeBlue, ~350 µm, 0.015-0.028 Ω-cm) using NaOH electrolyte at 0.01 wt% concentration for 20 min.

substrate.initial_surface_condition: CMP-processed, cleaned via wet chemical method [19]

samples.experiment_context: Anodic oxidation (AO) of N-type 4H-SiC (0001) wafer using NaCl electrolyte at 0.01 wt% concentration for 30 min for structural analysis.

characterization.oxide_layer_morphology: Porous, rough interface with bulk SiC

samples.experiment_context: Anodic oxidation (AO) of N-type 4H-SiC (0001) wafer using NaCl electrolyte at 0.1 wt% concentration for 30 min for structural analysis.

characterization.oxide_layer_morphology: Fewer/smaller pores, smoother interface than 0.01 wt%

samples.experiment_context: Anodic oxidation (AO) of N-type 4H-SiC (0001) wafer using NaCl electrolyte at 5 wt% concentration for 30 min for structural analysis.

characterization.oxide_layer_morphology: No visible pores, considerably smooth interface, dense layer

samples.experiment_context: Anodic oxidation (AO) of N-type 4H-SiC (0001) wafer using various NaCl electrolyte concentrations (0.01-5 wt%) at a constant current density of 3 mA/cm² for 30 s.

characterization.surface_morphology_after_etching: Pits observed, caused by non-uniform oxidation (Fig 8a)

samples.experiment_context: Anodic oxidation (AO) of N-type 4H-SiC (0001) wafer using various NaCl electrolyte concentrations (0.01-5 wt%) at a constant current density of 10 mA/cm² for 30 s.
Slurryless Electrochemical Mechanical Polishing (ECMP) of N-type 4H-SiC (0001) wafer using 0.01 wt% NaCl electrolyte.

characterization.surface_morphology: Polishing marks observed, less uniform. Many pits from non-uniform oxidation. Residual oxide in pits (EDX Fig 13). (Fig 11a, 12a)

elemental_composition.pit_area: Higher O peak compared to C

cmp_performance.measurement_method_used: Stylus profiler (Surfcom 1400D) for MRR (polishing depth), SWLI/SEM for topography
